instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Can we know the 820-xxxxx code of your board?
Remember to post it in title, when open new thread.

What about <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> voltages?
If nothing, check diode mode to ground.

Any history available?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
"<CAPACITOR>C3100</CAPACITOR> is in short is beep I don't know if it's normal to bep from both sides"
Seems to have short to ground on <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> rail; what is the exact resistance (ohm scale)?
<RESISTOR>R6923</RESISTOR> may be also bad.

You've been asked to check something more, apart of voltages in a previous post.
